revised_title: Region-specific Regulation of the Actin Multi-gene Family in Early Amphibian Embryos
tldr: The article investigates the region-specific regulation of the actin multi-gene family in early amphibian embryos. It shows that the actin genes are activated at the end of gastrulation and that muscle-specific actin genes are expressed in a cell-type specific manner. The study also reveals that the molecular mechanisms controlling embryonic cell determination occur before genes encoding products of terminal differentiation are activated.
